a.g: Sad. By the Qur'an containing reminder...
But those who disbelieve are in pride and dissension.
How many a generation have We destroyed before them, and they [then] called out; but it was not a time for escape.
And they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves. And the disbelievers say, "This is a magician and a liar.
Has he made the gods [only] one God? Indeed, this is a curious thing."
And the eminent among them went forth, [saying], "Continue, and be patient over [the defense of] your gods. Indeed, this is a thing intended.
We have not heard of this in the latest religion. This is not but a fabrication.
Has the message been revealed to him out of [all of] us?" Rather, they are in doubt about My message. Rather, they have not yet tasted My punishment.
Or do they have the depositories of the mercy of your Lord, the Exalted in Might, the Bestower?
Or is theirs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend through [any] ways of access.
[They are but] soldiers [who will be] defeated there among the companies [of disbelievers].
The people of Noah denied before them, and [the tribe of] 'Aad and Pharaoh, the owner of stakes,
And [the tribe of] Thamud and the people of Lot and the companions of the thicket. Those are the companies.
Each of them denied the messengers, so My penalty was justified.
And these [disbelievers] await not but one blast [of the Horn]; for it there will be no delay.
And they say, "Our Lord, hasten for us our share [of the punishment] before the Day of Account"
Be patient over what they say and remember Our servant, David, the possessor of strength; indeed, he was one who repeatedly turned back [to Allah].
Indeed, We subjected the mountains [to praise] with him, exalting [Allah] in the [late] afternoon and [after] sunrise.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
إن وقت الإشراق هو حين تنبسط الشمس وترتفع قدر نصف رمح، فيظهر نورها التام بارتفاعها عن موازات البخارات والغبارات التي على وجه الأرض، إذ تمنع إشرافها الكامل، وهذا الوقت هو الذي أراده الله تعالى بقوله: ﴿ يسبحن بالعشي والإشراق ﴾، ففيه يشرق القلب بتجليات النور الإلهي، ويستعد للصلاة التي هي مناجاة بين العبد وربه، فيسبح بحمد ربه ويقدسه، فالإشراق ليس مجرد طلوع الشمس، بل هو انكشاف الحجب عن البصيرة لترى أنوار الحق سبحانه، فتكون الصلاة في هذا الوقت إقراراً بتسبيح الكون كله للخالق، واتصالاً بالأنوار التي لا تحجبها الأغبرة الأرضية.
Indeed, the time of sunrise [al-ishraq] is when the sun expands and rises the measure of half a spear, so its complete light appears by its rising above being parallel to the vapors and dust particles that are upon the face of the earth, for they prevent its full emergence. And this time is what God, the Exalted, intended by His saying: "They glorify in the late afternoon and at sunrise [al-ishraq]." So in it, the heart [qalb] shines with the manifestations of the Divine Light [al-nur al-ilahi], and it prepares for the prayer [al-salah] which is an intimate discourse between the servant and his Lord, so he glorifies with the praise of his Lord and sanctifies Him. Thus, sunrise [al-ishraq] is not merely the rising of the sun, but rather it is the removal of the veils [al-hujub] from the insight [al-basirah] so that it may see the lights of the Truth [anwar al-haqq], glorified be He. Therefore, the prayer [al-salah] in this time is an affirmation of the glorification of the entire creation for the Creator, and a connection to the lights which the earthly dusts do not veil.

a.g: And the birds were assembled, all with him repeating [praises].
And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and discernment in speech.
And has there come to you the news of the adversaries, when they climbed over the wall of [his] prayer chamber -

When they entered upon David and he was alarmed by them? They said, "Fear not. [We are] two adversaries, one of whom has wronged the other, so judge between us with truth and do not exceed [it] and guide us to the sound path.
Indeed this, my brother, has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe; so he said, 'Entrust her to me,' and he overpowered me in speech."

[David] said, "He has certainly wronged you in demanding your ewe [in addition] to his ewes. And indeed, many associates oppress one another, except for those who believe and do righteous deeds - and few are they." And David became certain that We had tried him, and he asked forgiveness of his Lord and fell down bowing [in prostration] and turned in repentance [to Allah].
So We forgave him that; and indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.

[We said], "O David, indeed We have made you a successor upon the earth, so judge between the people in truth and do not follow [your own] desire, as it will lead you astray from the way of Allah." Indeed, those who go astray from the way of Allah will have a severe punishment for having forgotten the Day of Account.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
يا أمير المؤمنين أتدري ما جاء في تأويل هذه الآية عن جدك يا داود إنا جعلناك خليفة في الأرض فاحكم بين الناس بالحق ولا تتبع الهوى فيضلك عن سبيل الله قال الله تعالى في الزبور يا داود إذا قعد الخصمان بين يديك فكان لك في أحدهما هوى فلا تتمنين في نفسك أن يكون الحق له فيفلح على صاحبه فأمحوك عن نبوتي ثم لا تكون خلفتي ولا كرامة يا داود إنما جعلت رسلي إلى عبادي رعاء كرعاء الإبل لعلمهم بالرعاية ورفقهم بالسياسة ليجبروا الكسير ويدلوا الهزيل على الكلأ والماء يا أمير المؤمنين
O Commander of the Faithful, do you know what came in the interpretation of this verse from your grandfather? O David, indeed We have made you a successor [khalifah] in the earth, so judge between the people in truth and do not follow desire [hawa], lest it lead you astray from the path of God. God, the Exalted, said in the Psalms: O David, when the two disputants sit before you, and you have a desire [hawa] for one of them, then do not wish within yourself that the truth [haqq] be for him so that he may triumph over his adversary, for I will erase you from My prophethood [nubuwwah], and then you will not be My successor [khalifah] nor will you have honor. O David, I have only sent My messengers to My servants as shepherds, like the shepherds of camels, because of their knowledge of shepherding and their gentleness in governance, so that they may mend the broken, and guide the weak to the pasture and the water. O Commander of the Faithful.

a.g: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and that between them aimlessly. That is the assumption of those who disbelieve, so woe to those who disbelieve from the Fire.
Or should we treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like corrupters in the land? Or should We treat those who fear Allah like the wicked?
[This is] a blessed Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], that they might reflect upon its verses and that those of understanding would be reminded.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ولكونه حاضرا في القلب ومنسيا بالشغل عنه سمي الله تعالى جميع معارف الإيمان تذكرا فقال تعالى: ﴿ وليتذكر اولو الالباب ﴾ {} فهذا هو علاج الصبر عن الوساوس والشواغل وهو آخر درجات الصبر.
Indeed, because it is present within the heart [qalb] yet forgotten due to preoccupation away from it, Allah the Exalted has named all the knowledges [ma'arif] of faith 'remembrance' [tadhkira], as He said: "And that those of understanding may remember." This, then, is the remedy for patience [sabr] against whisperings and distractions, and it is the final degree of patience [sabr].

a.g: And to David We gave Solomon. An excellent servant, indeed he was one repeatedly turning back [to Allah].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد أثنى الله عز وجل على عباده في مواضع على أعمالهم وهو خالقها وفاطر القدرة عليها نحو قوله تعالى: ﴿ نعم العبد إنه أواب ﴾ {} إلى غير ذلك
Indeed, Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, has praised His servants in various places for their deeds, while He is the Creator of them and the Originator of the capability for them, such as His saying, the Exalted: "An excellent servant [‘abd]! Indeed, he was one repeatedly returning [awwāb]." {38:30} and other similar verses.

a.g: [Mention] when there were exhibited before him in the afternoon the poised [standing] racehorses.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ينبغي للمصلي إذا فرغ من الوضوء والطهارة من الخبث في البدن والمكان والثياب وستر العورة من السرة إلى الركبة أن ينتصب قائما متوجها إلى القبلة ويزاوج بين قدميه ولا يضمهما فإن ذلك مما كان يستدل به على فقه الرجل وقد (نهى ﭬ عن الصفن والصفد في الصلاة[53]) والصفد هو اقتران القدمين معا ومنه قوله تعالى: ﴿ ( مقرنين في الأصفاد ﴾ {إبراهيم: 49} والصفن هو رفع إحدى الرجلين ومنه قوله عز وجل: ﴿ الصافنات الجياد ﴾ {ص: 31} هذا ما يراعيه في رجليه عند القيام ويراعي في ركبتيه ومعقد نطاقه الانتصاب وأما رأسه إن شاء تركه على استواء القيام وإن شاء أطرق والإطراق أقرب للخشوع وأغضّ للبصر وليكن بصره محصورا على مصلاه الذي يصلي عليه فإن لم يكن له مصلى فليقرب من جدار الحائط أو ليخط خطا فإن ذلك يقصر مسافة البصر ويمنع تفرّق الفكر وليحجر على بصره أن يجاوز أطراف المصلى وحدود الخط وليدم على هذا القيام.
Indeed, it is fitting for the one who prays [al-musalli], when he has completed the ablution [al-wudu'] and the purification from filth [al-khabath] in the body, the place, and the garments, and has covered the private parts [al-'awrah] from the navel to the knees, that he stand upright, facing the Qiblah, and that he separate his feet and not join them together, for that was among the things by which a man's jurisprudence [fiqh] was recognized. And He, may He be glorified and exalted, has forbidden the *safn* and the *safad* in prayer. And the *safad* is the joining of the two feet together; from it is His saying, the Exalted: "...bound together in fetters [al-asfad]" (Ibrahim: 49). And the *safn* is the raising of one of the legs; from it is His saying, the Mighty and Majestic: "...the pawing, thoroughbred horses [al-safinat al-jiyad]" (Sad: 31). This is what he observes concerning his legs during the standing [al-qiyam]. And he observes in his knees and the place of his belt [niṭaq] the uprightness [al-intisab]. As for his head, if he wishes, he may leave it aligned with the uprightness of the standing, and if he wishes, he may lower it [atraqa], and lowering is closer to humility [al-khushu'] and more restraining for the gaze. And let his sight be confined to his prayer-place [musalla] upon which he prays. If he does not have a designated prayer-place, then let him draw near to the wall of a structure, or let him draw a line, for that shortens the distance of the sight and prevents the scattering of thought [al-fikr]. And let him restrain his gaze from exceeding the edges of the prayer-place and the boundaries of the line. And let him persist in this standing [al-qiyam].

a.g: And he said, "Indeed, I gave preference to the love of good [things] over the remembrance of my Lord until the sun disappeared into the curtain [of darkness]."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقوله عز وجل ﴿ حتى توارت الحجاب ﴾ {} أراد الشمس وما سبق لها ذكر
Indeed, until it was concealed by the veil [al-hijab]. He, the Mighty and Majestic, intended the sun, and what preceded it of mention.

a.g: [He said], "Return them to me," and set about striking [their] legs and necks.
And We certainly tried Solomon and placed on his throne a body; then he returned.
He said, "My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom such as will not belong to anyone after me. Indeed, You are the Bestower."
So We subjected to him the wind blowing by his command, gently, wherever he directed,
And [also] the devils [of jinn] - every builder and diver
And others bound together in shackles.
[We said], "This is Our gift, so grant or withhold without account."
And indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.
And remember Our servant Job, when he called to his Lord, "Indeed, Satan has touched me with hardship and torment."
[So he was told], "Strike [the ground] with your foot; this is a [spring for] a cool bath and drink."
And We granted him his family and a like [number] with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for those of understanding.

[We said], "And take in your hand a bunch [of grass] and strike with it and do not break your oath." Indeed, We found him patient, an excellent servant. Indeed, he was one repeatedly turning back [to Allah].
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وكان حبيب بن أبي حبيب إذا قرأ هذه الآية: ﴿ إنا وجدناه صابرا نعم العبد إنه أواب ﴾ {} بكى وقال واعجباه اعطى واثنى أي هو المعطي للصبر وهو المثنى.
Indeed, when Habib ibn Abi Habib would recite this verse: "Indeed, We found him patient [ṣābirān]. An excellent servant! Indeed, he was one who repeatedly turned [awwāb]" (38:44), he would weep and say: "How wondrous! He gave and He praised." That is, He is the Giver [al-Mu'ṭī] of patience [ṣabr], and He is the One who praises [al-Māthnī].

a.g: And remember Our servants, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - those of strength and [religious] vision.
Indeed, We chose them for an exclusive quality: remembrance of the home [of the Hereafter].
And indeed they are, to Us, among the chosen and outstanding.
And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhul-Kifl, and all are among the outstanding.
This is a reminder. And indeed, for the righteous is a good place of return
Gardens of perpetual residence, whose doors will be opened to them.
Reclining within them, they will call therein for abundant fruit and drink.
And with them will be women limiting [their] glances and of equal age.
This is what you, [the righteous], are promised for the Day of Account.
Indeed, this is Our provision; for it there is no depletion.
This [is so]. But indeed, for the transgressors is an evil place of return -
Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the resting place.
This - so let them taste it - is scalding water and [foul] purulence.
And other [punishments] of its type [in various] kinds.
[Its inhabitants will say], "This is a company bursting in with you. No welcome for them. Indeed, they will burn in the Fire."
They will say, "Nor you! No welcome for you. You, [our leaders], brought this upon us, and wretched is the settlement."
They will say, "Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us - increase for him double punishment in the Fire."
And they will say, "Why do we not see men whom we used to count among the worst?
Is it [because] we took them in ridicule, or has [our] vision turned away from them?"
Indeed, that is truth - the quarreling of the people of the Fire.
Say, [O Muhammad], "I am only a warner, and there is not any deity except Allah, the One, the Prevailing.
Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver."
Say, "It is great news
From which you turn away.
I had no knowledge of the exalted assembly [of angels] when they were disputing [the creation of Adam].
It has not been revealed to me except that I am a clear warner."
[So mention] when your Lord said to the angels, "Indeed, I am going to create a human being from clay.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فالنفس المدركة بالبصيرة أعظم قدراً من الجسد المدرك بالبصر. ولذلك عظم الله أمره بإضافته إليه إذ قال تعالى "إني خالق بشراً من طين فإذا سويته ونفخت فيه من روحي فقعوا له ساجدين" فنبه على أن الجسد منسوب إلى الطين والروح إلى رب العالمين. والمراد بالروح والنفس في هذا المقام واحد؛ فالخلق عبارة عن هيئة في النفس راسخة، عنها تصدر الأفعال بسهولة ويسر من غير حاجة إلى فكر وروية، فإن كانت الهيئة بحيث تصدر عنها الأفعال الجميلة المحمودة عقلاً وشرعاً سميت تلك الهيئة خلقاً حسناً، وإن كان الصادر عنها الأفعال القبيحة سميت الهيئة التي هي المصدر خلقاً شيئاً.
Indeed, the soul [nafs] perceived by inner sight [basira] is of greater stature than the body perceived by outer sight [basar]. And for this reason, Allah magnified its affair by attributing it to Himself, when He, the Exalted, said: "Indeed, I am creating a human [bashar] from clay. So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My spirit [ruh], then fall down to him in prostration." Thus, He alerted that the body is ascribed to the clay, and the spirit [ruh] to the Lord of the worlds. And what is intended by the spirit [ruh] and the soul [nafs] in this context is one. And character [khuluq] is an expression for a firmly established state [haya] in the soul [nafs], from which actions issue forth with ease and facility, without need for thought and deliberation. If that state [haya] is such that beautiful, praiseworthy actions—by reason [aql] and sacred law [shar']—issue from it, then that state [haya] is called a good character [khuluq hasan]. And if what issues from it is vile actions, then the state [haya] which is the source is called a bad character [khuluq sayyi'].

a.g: So when I have proportioned him and breathed into him of My [created] soul, then fall down to him in prostration."
So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely.
Except Iblees; he was arrogant and became among the disbelievers.
[Allah] said, "O Iblees, what prevented you from prostrating to that which I created with My hands? Were you arrogant [then], or were you [already] among the haughty?"
He said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."
[Allah] said, "Then get out of Paradise, for indeed, you are expelled.
And indeed, upon you is My curse until the Day of Recompense."
He said, "My Lord, then reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."
[Allah] said, "So indeed, you are of those reprieved
Until the Day of the time well-known."
[Iblees] said, "By your might, I will surely mislead them all
Except, among them, Your chosen servants."
[Allah] said, "The truth [is My oath], and the truth I say -
[That] I will surely fill Hell with you and those of them that follow you all together."
Say, [O Muhammad], "I do not ask you for the Qur'an any payment, and I am not of the pretentious
It is but a reminder to the worlds.
And you will surely know [the truth of] its information after a time."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
ويظن أن ما وقع به من حدس وتخمين علم اليقين وعين اليقين ﴿ ولتعلمن نبأه بعد حين ﴾{} وينبغي أن ينشد في هؤلاء عند كشف الغطاء: أحسنت ظنك بالأيام إذ حسنت ولم تخف سوء ما يأتي به القدر وسالمتك الليالي فاغتررت بها وعند صفو الليالي يحدث الكدر واعلم يقينا أن كل من فارق الإيمان الساذج بالله ورسوله وكتبه وخاض في البحث فقد تعرض لهذا الخطر ومثاله مثال من انكسرت سفينته وهو في ملتطم الأمواج يرميه موج إلى موج فربما يتفق أن يلقيه إلى الساحل وذلك بعيد والهلاك عليه أغلب.
Indeed, he imagines that what has befallen him of conjecture [hads] and guesswork is the knowledge of certainty ['ilm al-yaqin] and the essence of certainty ['ayn al-yaqin]. **"And you will surely know its news after a time."** And it is fitting that concerning these, upon the lifting of the veil [kashf al-ghita'], it be recited: "You thought well of the days when they were good, and did not fear the evil that fate might bring; and the nights were safe for you, so you were deceived by them, yet in the midst of clear nights, turbidity occurs." And know with certainty [yaqin] that everyone who abandons the simple faith [al-iman al-sadhidh] in Allah, His Messenger, and His Books, and plunges into investigation [al-bahth], has indeed exposed himself to this danger. His example is like one whose ship has broken while he is in the surging waves; one wave throws him to another, and perhaps by chance it casts him to the shore—and that is remote—while destruction [al-halak] is more likely for him.
